name: onelogin
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing OneLogin cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`onelogin` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/onelogin/terraform-provider-onelogin).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing OneLogin cloud resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/onelogin/terraform-provider-onelogin)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-onelogin` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-onelogin/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-onelogin` repo](https://github.com/onelogin/terraform-provider-onelogin/issues).

python.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/onelogin/terraform-provider-onelogin)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-onelogin` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-onelogin/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-onelogin` repo](https://github.com/onelogin/terraform-provider-onelogin/issues).

values.description: Only applicable to provisioned and set_* actions. Items in the array will be a plain text string or valid value for the selected action.

operator.description: A valid operator for the selected condition source

value.description: A plain text string or valid value for the selected  condition source

accessTokenExpirationMinutes.description: OIDC Apps only Number of minutes the refresh token will be valid for.

loginUrl.description: OIDC Apps only The OpenId Connect Client Id. Note that client_secret is only returned after Creating an App.

redirectUri.description: OIDC Apps only Comma or newline separated list of valid redirect uris for the OpenId Connect Authorization Code flow.

refreshTokenExpirationMinutes.description: Number of minutes the refresh token will be valid for.

tokenEndpointAuthMethod.description:
OIDC Apps only
 - 0: Basic
 - 1: POST
 - 2: None / PKCE

caseSensitive.description: The URL path evaluation is case insensitive by default. Resources hosted on web servers such as Apache, NGINX and Java EE are case sensitive paths. Web servers such as Microsoft IIS are not case-sensitive.

conditions.description: If access is conditional, the conditions that must evaluate to true to allow access to a resource. For example, to require the user must be authenticated and have either the role Admin or User

contextRoot.description: The root path to the application, often the name of the application. Can be any name, path or just a slash (“/”). The context root uniquely identifies the application within the enforcement point.

landingPage.description: The location within the context root to which the browser will be redirected for IdP-initiated single sign-on. For example, the landing page might be an index page in the context root such as index.html or default.aspx. The landing page cannot begin with a slash and must use valid URL characters.

permissions.description: Specify to always `allow`, `deny` access to resources, of if access is `conditional`.

requireSitewideAuthentication.description: Require user authentication to access any resource protected by this enforcement point.

sessionExpiryFixed.description: unit: - 0 = Seconds - 1 = Minutes - 2 = Hours value: - When Unit = 0 or 1 value must be 0-60 - When Unit = 2 value must be 0-24

sessionExpiryInactivity.description: unit: - 0 = Seconds - 1 = Minutes - 2 = Hours value: - When Unit = 0 or 1 value must be 0-60 - When Unit = 2 value must be 0-24

target.description: A fully-qualified URL to the internal application including scheme, authority and path. The target host authority must be an IP address, not a hostname.

token.description: Can only be set on create. Access Gateway Token.

useTargetHostHeader.description: Use the target host header as opposed to the original gateway or upstream host header.

vhost.description: A comma-delimited list of one or more virtual hosts that map to applications assigned to the enforcement point. A VHOST may be a host name or an IP address. VHOST distinguish between applications that are at the same context root.

acsUrl.description: App Name.	This is only returned after Creating a SAML App.

certificate.description: The certificate used for signing.	This is only returned after Creating a SAML App.

clientId.description: The OpenId Connect Client Id. Note that client_secret is only returned after Creating an OIDC App.

issuer.description: Issuer of app.	This is only returned after Creating a SAML App.

metadataUrl.description: ID of the apps underlying connector.	This is only returned after Creating a SAML App.

accessTokenExpirationMinutes.description: The number of minutes until access token expires. There is no maximum expiry limit.

audiences.description: List of API endpoints that will be returned in Access Tokens.

refreshTokenExpirationMinutes.description: The number of minutes until refresh token expires. There is no maximum expiry limit.

resourceIdentifier.description: Unique identifier for the API that the Authorization Server will issue Access Tokens for.

actions.description:
An array of strings that represent actions within OneLogin. Actions are prefixed with the class of object they are related to and followed by a specific action for the given class.
e.g. users:List, where the class is users and the specific action is List. Don’t mix classes within an Action array. To create a privilege that includes multiple different classes, create multiple statements. A wildcard * that includes all actions is supported. Use wildcards to create a Super User privilege.

effect.description: Set to “Allow.” By default, all actions are denied, this Statement allows the listed actions to be executed.

scopes.description:
Target the privileged action against specific resources with the scope.
The scope pattern is the class of object used by the Action, followed by an ID that represents a resource in OneLogin.
e.g. apps/1234, where apps is the class and 1234 is the ID of an app.
The wildcard * is supported and indicates that all resources of the class type declared, in the Action, are in scope.
The Action and Scope classes must match. However, there is an exception, a scope of roles/{role_id} can be combined with Actions on the user or app class. The exception allows you to target groups of users or apps with specific actions.

apps.description: Use this to override the resource endpoint URL (the default one or the one constructed from the `region`).

users.description: Use this to override the resource endpoint URL (the default one or the one constructed from the `region`).

usersV1.description: Use this to override the resource endpoint URL (the default one or the one constructed from the `region`).

id.description: A unique id that represents the source of the event.
A unique id that represents the source of the event.

provider.description:
The provider type for the onelogin package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

conditions.description: An array of conditions that the user must meet in order for the rule to be applied.

enabled.description: Indicates if the rule is enabled or not.

match.description: Indicates how conditions should be matched.

position.description: Indicates the order of the rule. When `null` this will default to last position.

conditions.description: An array of conditions that the user must meet in order for the rule to be applied.

enabled.description: Indicates if the rule is enabled or not.

match.description: Indicates how conditions should be matched.

position.description: Indicates the order of the rule. When `null` this will default to last position.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Rules resources.

conditions.description: An array of conditions that the user must meet in order for the rule to be applied.

enabled.description: Indicates if the rule is enabled or not.

match.description: Indicates how conditions should be matched.

position.description: Indicates the order of the rule. When `null` this will default to last position.

allowAssumedSignin.description: Indicates whether or not administrators can access the app as a user that they have assumed control over.

authMethod.description:
An ID indicating the type of app: - 0: Password - 1: OpenId - 2: SAML - 3: API - 4: Google - 6: Forms Based App - 7:
WSFED - 8: OpenId Connect

configuration.description: Only apply configurations that are applicable to the type of app

connectorId.description: ID of the connector to base the app from.

createdAt.description: the date the app was created

enforcementPoint.description:
For apps that connect to a OneLogin Access Enforcement Point the following enforcement_point object will be included
with the app payload.

iconUrl.description: A link to the apps icon url

policyId.description: The security policy assigned to the app.

provisioning.description: Indicates if provisioning is enabled for this app.

roleIds.description:
List of Role IDs that are assigned to the app. On App Create or Update the entire array is replaced with the values
provided.

sso.description:
The attributes included in the sso section are determined by the type of app. All of the attributes of the `sso` object
are read only.

tabId.description: ID of the OneLogin portal tab that the app is assigned to.

updatedAt.description: the date the app was last updated

visible.description: Indicates if the app is visible in the OneLogin portal.

allowAssumedSignin.description: Indicates whether or not administrators can access the app as a user that they have assumed control over.

source.description: Used for targeting custom rules based on a group of people, customers, accounts, or even a single user.

comment.description: Free text related to the user.

directoryId.description: The ID of the OneLogin Directory of the user.

distinguishedName.description: The distinguished name of the user.

email.description: A valid email for the user.

externalId.description: The ID of the user in an external directory.

groupId.description: The ID of the Group in OneLogin that the user is assigned to.

managerAdId.description: The ID of the user's manager in Active Directory.

managerUserId.description: The OneLogin User ID for the user's manager.

password.description: The password to set for a user.

passwordAlgorithm.description:
Use this when importing a password that's already hashed. Prepend the salt value to the cleartext password value before
SHA-256-encoding it

passwordConfirmation.description: Required if the password is being set.

phone.description: The E.164 format phone number for a user.

roleIds.description: A list of OneLogin Role IDs of the user

salt.description: The salt value used with the password_algorithm.

trustedIdpId.description: The ID of the OneLogin Trusted IDP of the user.

userprincipalname.description: The principle name of the user.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering V1 resources.

comment.description: Free text related to the user.

directoryId.description: The ID of the OneLogin Directory of the user.

distinguishedName.description: The distinguished name of the user.

email.description: A valid email for the user.

externalId.description: The ID of the user in an external directory.

groupId.description: The ID of the Group in OneLogin that the user is assigned to.

managerAdId.description: The ID of the user's manager in Active Directory.

managerUserId.description: The OneLogin User ID for the user's manager.

password.description: The password to set for a user.

passwordAlgorithm.description:
Use this when importing a password that's already hashed. Prepend the salt value to the cleartext password value before
SHA-256-encoding it

passwordConfirmation.description: Required if the password is being set.

phone.description: The E.164 format phone number for a user.

roleIds.description: A list of OneLogin Role IDs of the user

salt.description: The salt value used with the password_algorithm.

trustedIdpId.description: The ID of the OneLogin Trusted IDP of the user.

userprincipalname.description: The principle name of the user.
